required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Thai Massage on Patients With Wrist Extensor Muscles Latent Myofascial Trigger Points
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Thai Massage on Patients With Wrist Extensor Muscles Latent Myofascial Trigger Points

oversight_info.authority: Thailand:The Ethics Committee of School of Health Science, Mae Fah Luang University

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to investigate the effect of Thai massage on pressure pain threshold, pain intensity, wrist range of motion, grip strength and patient satisfaction in patients with wrist extensor muscles latent Myofascial trigger points.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Pressure Pain Threshold as a measure by algometry

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain scores on visual analog scale
Wrist Range of motion as a Measure by goniometer
Grip strength as a measure by hand-held dynamometer

clinical_study.condition: Patients With Latent Myofascial Trigger Point

arm_group.description: The participants will receive a thirty minutes session of Thai massage onto the wrist extensor groups muscle for 9 sessions
The participants will receive a thirty minutes session of sham ultrasound therapy onto the wrist extensor groups muscle for 9 sessions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female
- Age between 18 - 40 years old
- The participants have at least one latent trigger point in the wrist extensor groups muscles.
- The participants will be able to follow instructions.
- Good communication and cooperation.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contraindications of traditional Thai massage
- Tennis elbow or Golf's elbow
- Poor skin sentation

facility.name: School of Health Science, Mae Fah Luang University

responsible_party.investigator_title: Head of School of physical Therapy, Mae Fah Luang University
